meanings.definition: Gasking (verb): to stare in wonder or amazement
meanings.sent1: The children were gasking at the magician's tricks.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help gasking at the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent3: Everyone in the audience was gasking at the unexpected twist in the play.
meanings.sent4: His eyes gasked at the sight of the shooting star streaking across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The little girl gasked in awe as she watched the fireworks light up the night sky.

meanings.definition: Gasking (noun): a look of astonishment or curiosity
meanings.sent1: The professor's gasking caught the attention of the students.
meanings.sent2: She wore a gasking expression when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: His gasking made everyone laugh during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The gasking on their faces was priceless when they saw the puppy for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The child's gasking was so adorable when she saw the bubbles floating in the air.
